all: Dev tutorials, thoughts on software development, and the occasional off-topic post.
dev: Technical posts and tutorials covering a range of languages, technologies, and concepts.
off-topic: Who says a dev blog has to be just about dev? I also like to write about other stuff.
jekyll: Jekyll is a static site generator written in Ruby, with support for Liquid templating and Sass out of the box.
math: Love it or hate it, math is all around us!
frontend: Tutorials and guides on front-end development.
css: CSS is powerfulâ€”use it well, and you can create stunning experiences on the web.
accessibility: All kinds of people visit your site. So how do you ensure that your user experience remains... well... usable?
gaming: Video games have always been one of my favorite pastimes. There's nothing quite like being immersed in a different world!
seo: How do you get in front of the right audiences and take that coveted number-one spot on Google? Answer: with SEO. It's the art and science of optimizing your pages to attract the right traffic.
react: Tutorials and guides on React, a popular JavaScript framework.
webperf: Web performance (commonly referred to as *webperf* for short) is the art of optimizing a website for the best possible user experience, load times, and SEO.
